intro: Schuurmansia rauwolfioides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves and is often used in ornamental gardening. Schuurmansia rauwolfioides is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
